__e: It depends whether I write about what I do or what I think about doing.
Seems the more time I spend doing the job, The less I feel like writing about it,
I write about where I am, or I should, because if I don't, it's shit.
I am writing to tell you the truth, before it is too late.
"Dear mother, I'm writing to tell you that I know... what it'd take to make me happy.
I write for the working stiff, the guy that takes the 7 train, the guy who worries whether his kid needs a new pair of shoes or not.

I write myself a "Thanks for being such an amazing dad" card, then I drink myself into oblivion so I forget what I've written, and then 12 months later, on Father's Day, which, by the way, happens to be today,
If I write to a friend and say that I was taking off after a shift to be with the guy I love.
Every time I write one of those letters I promise myself it'll be the last one.
"This is probably the first and the last time..." "... I write a letter to you like this."
This is the reason why I am writing a letter to you because I feel really bad inside my stomach.
Now, you may not believe this... but the reason I won't write you a letter is 'cause I'm convinced that this is the only place I can keep you where you'll be safe from yourself.
You must be mad, the school makes me write enough of these letters do you think I want to write more?
How about I write down for you, on a single piece of paper, everything... everything you need to know about yourself?
I fill in my diary every night, whether anything happened that day or not.
Yes...no, I mean I write a little for myself.
I certainly can't work with people that I wrote a book about.
Maybe you don't know.. ...but every month I write out a check to my father.
